Basic.desc: Basic test vectors use the simplest possible inputs. These inputs often overlap with inputs from standards and RFCs. One goal of such test vectors is to simply detect distinct algorithms.

InvalidCiphertext.desc: The test vector contains a ciphertext that is invalid. The invalidity of the ciphertext can (and should) be determined before attempting to decrypt. Hence padding attacks should not be possible with this kind of modifications.

ModifiedPadding.desc: The test vector contains a ciphertext where the padding has been modified.
ModifiedPadding.effect: Accepting RSA ciphertexts with modified padding often simplify chosen ciphertext attacks.

tests.comment: Prepended a zero to the ciphertext
The encrypted message is too long.
Replaced the padding by an array of 0xff bytes
Using a signature padding instead of encryption padding
